title: Self-Determination Theory-Based Microlearning for Improving Procedural Task Instruction Effectiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Procedural task instruction education applying self-determination theory in smartphone-based constrained technology environments, targeting graduate students in social sciences with advanced domain expertise through 10-15 minute modular learning combining theory and cases

learning_goals: Learners can compare three types of procedural instruction methods (long-form/short-form/choice-providing) and explain factors influencing work efficiency.
Learners can apply Self-Determination Theory to propose at least two autonomy-supportive strategies when designing work instructions.
Learners perform simulation tasks provided in a mobile environment with over 80% accuracy and analyze response differences based on instruction methods.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
